poem:
**Foam Ceiling, New Year**

At 1:30  
the bottle-sparklers—  
small, foolish stars—  
lifted to the low foam sky.

Then the room took fire  
as if it had waited  
all year  
for that permission.

Names queued in snow.  
Teenage breath  
turned to smoke.

Managers under "negligence,"  
but the ceiling  
was the first to say yes.
